text:
Kingman is a city in Kingman County, Kansas, United States. It is also the county seat of Kingman County. In 2010, 3,177 people lived there.
History.
Kingman was planned out in 1874. It was named for Samuel A. Kingman, chief justice of the supreme court.
Geography.
Kingman is at (37.647024, -98.113805). The United States Census Bureau says taht the city has a total area of. Of that, is land and is water.
Climate.
Kingman has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The Köppen Climate Classification system says that Kingman has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 3,177 people, 1,346 households, and 810 families living in Kingman.
Transportation.
Bus service is provided daily east to Wichita, Kansas and west to Pueblo, Colorado by BeeLine Express (subcontractor of Greyhound Lines).
